TopicTitle: Revert flight and quickloading not working. Had to manually reset save file.

Articles.Content:
So I found that twice, upon crashing my lifter I could not revert though I made sure that the game was on normal difficulty with reverts allowed. I tried quickloading too but nothing happened. Now twice I have had to go into the save file and manually reset the state of my orange suits to alive and get back the money and rep lost ![;.;](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cry.gif). Anyone else have this? Is there a way to stop it? Is it just a bug? 

I cant exit to the space center either so this means I was forced to exit the game.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-02T01:29:07Z" title="05/02/2015 01:29  AM" data-short="9 yr">May 2, 2015</time> by Claw**
Please see the support stickies and provide your game logs ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
I quit the game and restarted it and I'm not able to replicate it. I has happened twice in two separate launches so it may well happen again. I didn't know how to post the logs before.

I quit the game and restarted it and I'm not able to replicate it. I has happened twice in two separate launches so it may well happen again. I didn't know how to post the logs before.

- - - Updated - - -

Okay so It's happening again and I can't return my Mun Science to the space center. None of the UI buttons working including the recover buttons. 

Output\_Log dropbox link - [https://www.dropbox.com/s/xyrr86pbdi414i0/output_log.txt?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/xyrr86pbdi414i0/output_log.txt?dl=0)

My System:

Ram - 8GB

Processor - AMD Athlon x4 860k

Graphics card - Nvidia GT730 with 4GB VRAM

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-01T01:32:49Z" title="05/01/2015 01:32  AM" data-short="9 yr">May 1, 2015</time> by SpacecraftX**
  
Added my system specs.

Well, I can see the bugs in your log but I can't tell what you are doing that's causing them. Looks like the first problem happened when you crashed. It's also happening later. Are you, by chance, decoupling multiple pods or probe cores at the same time?

Cheers,

~Claw

Yes I am decoupling 3 small pods at once. I need to return multiple Kerbals if for tourism or if I'm taking Pilots and Scientists so I used multiple pods because I'm saving up science for the larger one.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-01T13:49:30Z" title="05/01/2015 01:49  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 1, 2015</time> by SpacecraftX**

> 
> Yes I am decoupling 3 small pods at once.

Okay, that's your problem. It's an old bug, but decoupling multiple controlled ships from a single core causes this bug. You can decouple them one at a time as a workaround.

Cheers,

-Claw

Ah. Thanks. Never really encountered this before as until now I've never had a need to do that until career mode and the new aerodynamics and heating.

You've been super helpful.
